Key Match Events: LaMelo Ball had an active start to the game, finishing the first quarter with four points in six minutes, shooting 2-from-4 from the field.
LaMelo Ball sank his first 3-point attempt in the second quarter, entering halftime with seven points on 3-from-8 from the field.
The Hornets took the lead of the game, 46-45, at halftime.
LaMelo Ball added three points and four assists in the second half.
The Hornets ended the third quarter up 77-76.
LaMelo Ball scored a 27-foot step-back triple in the fourth quarter.
LaMelo Ball's floating jump shot with 24.1 seconds on the clock put the Hornets up 106-103.
Brandon Miller secured the win with a tip shot after Grant Williams missed a game-winning 3-pointer.
LaMelo Ball finished the game with 25 points on 10-from-23 from the field, including 5-from-12 from deep.
Pre-Game Insights: LaMelo Ball and the Charlotte Hornets hosted the Detroit Pistons at Spectrum Center, hoping to defy the odds (-1.5 handicap for the Pistons) and get their third win of the season.
Post-Match Reflections: LaMelo Ball and the Charlotte Hornets improved to 3-5 after the win.
The Hornets are playing better than expected and could lay the ground for more competitive seasons.
This result makes the Hornets an NBA play-in tournament team alongside the Bulls, Hawks, and Magic.
Charlotte snapped a three-game skid and will try to extend its good moment against the Pacers on Friday.
